title: [BUG] --serve-artifacts seems not working

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [ x ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: CentOS Linux release 7.9.2009 (Core)
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: binary
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.23.1
- **Python version**: 3.7.4
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**: N/A
- **Exact command to reproduce**: 
server started from $DIR, which is /home/meunier/MLFLOW, by command
`mlflow server --host 0.0.0.0 --port 3030 --backend-store-uri sqlite:///$DIR/data_NMT/server.db --serve-artifacts --artifacts-destination ./data_NMT --gunicorn-opts "--timeout 240"`
(I have also tried to give absolute path for --artifacts-destination)
client-side test:
`MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://myhost:3030 python mlflow_artifacts/example.py
`
### Describe the problem
I'm getting an error:
`OSError: [Errno 45] Operation not supported: '/home/meunier'`
but this path refers to the server-side file system.
It seems like if the client still trie to copy the artifact to the server area, despite the --serve-artifacts

### Code to reproduce issue
run a server by:
`mlflow server --host 0.0.0.0 --port 3030 --backend-store-uri sqlite:///$DIR/data_NMT/server.db --serve-artifacts --artifacts-destination ./data_NMT --gunicorn-opts "--timeout 240"`
run the  `mlflow_artifacts/example.py`  example **from a machine which cannot access the server disks**.

### Other info / logs
MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=http://my_server_host:3030 python mlflow_artifacts/example.py
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "mlflow_artifacts/example.py", line 42, in <module>
    main()
  File "mlflow_artifacts/example.py", line 28, in main
    mlflow.log_artifact(tmp_path_a)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 606, in log_artifact
    MlflowClient().log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 955, in log_artifact
    self._tracking_client.log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 355, in log_artifact
    artifact_repo.log_artifact(local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/local_artifact_repo.py", line 37, in log_artifact
    mkdir(artifact_dir)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 114, in mkdir
    raise e
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 111, in mkdir
    os.makedirs(target)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 213, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 213, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 213, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  [Previous line repeated 2 more times]
  File "/Users/meunier/opt/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 223, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
OSError: [Errno 45] Operation not supported: '/home/meunier'
```

### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [ x] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [x ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
